data.title: What’s Happening?: St. Patrick’s Day CEILI set for Saturday
data.meta_description: St. Patrick’s Day CEILI happening at 5:30 p.m. SaturdayThe Museum of Colorado Prisons will host its fifth annual St. Patrick’s Day CEILI at 5:30 p.m. Saturday at the Abbey Events Center, 2951 E. data.text:
St. Patrick’s Day CEILI happening at 5:30 p.m. Saturday

The Museum of Colorado Prisons will host its fifth annual St. Patrick’s Day CEILI at 5:30 p.m. Saturday at the Abbey Events Center, 2951 E. U.S. 50. Cocktails begin at 5:30 p.m., dinner and entertainment will follow. Cost is $32 per person, or $220 for a table of eight.

Tickets are available at the Cañon City Chamber of Commerce, the Abbey Events Center and the Museum of Colorado Prisons.

Artist reception slated for 2 p.m. Saturday

The John C. Fremont Library’s Featured Artist for March is Florence artist Tina Knapp. Her acrylic and oil paintings of landscapes and animals will be displayed at the library at 130 Church Avenue in Florence. The community is invited to a reception at 2 p.m. Saturday.

For more information, call 784-4649 or email Natalia.Gray@JCFLD.org.

Festival in the Park team captain meeting set for Monday

The Orchard of Hope Foundation will host its first team captain’s meeting at 6 p.m. Monday at Shepherd of the Hills Lutheran Church, 801 Sheridan. This meeting is for all teams who wish to participate in the Orchard of Hope Foundation’s “Festival in the Park,” formerly known as the Walk for Hope.

The foundation is making several changes this year and is seeking support from the community.

‘Old McFremont Had a Farm’ set for March 19

Sue Cochran, assistant archivist at the Royal Gorge Regional Museum and Historical Center, will present on the history of the dairy and poultry operations in Fremont County at 6 p.m. March 19 at the John C. Fremont Library, 130 Church Ave., in Florence. She will bring in a variety of “what-cha-ma-call-its,” or farm instruments and explain their uses.

For more information, call 784-4649 or email Natalia.Gray@JCFLD.org.

Tuesday Night at the Movies will be March 24

Tuesday Night at the Movies will feature “Blue Jasmin” at 6 p.m. March 24 at the John C. Fremont Library, 130 Church Ave., in Florence. Cate Blanchett stars as a former New York socialite teetering between her troubled past and a fresh start in San Francisco. Also starring Alec Baldwin and Sally Hawkins. Rated PG-13. Free popcorn, bring your own drink.

For more information, call 784-4649.

Gluten Free Meal Planning will be presented March 26

Gluten Free Meal Planning will be presented by Lexie Justice, the chef and owner of Cheatin’ Wheat in Denver, at 5 p.m. March 26 at the John C. Fremont Library, 130 Church Ave., in Florence. Justice will discuss how to plan gluten-free meals.

For more information, call 784-4649.

Daily Record Staff
